question: The World Health Organization (WHO) in collaboration with Maharashtra recommended triple-drug therapy for which of the following disease?
explanation: The World Health Organization (WHO) in collaboration with Maharashtra recommended triple-drug therapy for the patient suffering from Lymphatic Filariasis. More than 40% of cases of Lymphatic Filariasis are found in India. The combination of ivermectin, diethylcarbamazine citrate and albendazole will be used for treatment.
